newsitem.title: USA: Kodak may sell copy unit to Danka - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Kodak may sell copy unit to Danka - WSJ.

text.p: Eastman Kodak Co and Danka Business Systems Plc are discussing the possible sale of part of Kodak's copier business to Danka, the Wall Street Journal reported Friday.
Kodak officials declined to comment on the report.
The Journal, quoting sources, said one possibility would call for Danka to buy Kodak's customer-service and distribution organization for about $750 million.
Danka earns about 80 percent of its revenue from servicing copiers. A purchase of Kodak's copier service and distribution business would double its client list, according to the newspaper.
The division has been up for sale for nearly nine months and has suffered from poor earnings despite annual sales of $1.8 billion, the Journal reported.
A sale of the division would leave Kodak with copier manufacturing operations. The Journal said that sources had previously stated that Kodak had sought $1 billion for the unit.
Danka, based in London with headquarters in St. Petersburg, Florida, already sells Kodak copiers in the U.S. and Canada following an agreement signed last year.
